page.title: 12A GAMEKEEPER'S LIFE,PRESTON
page.content: A keeper's day starts very early in the morning.His job is to look after his beat and his pheasants.The year starts when the shooting has finished in January.First he catches up the hens and cocks to put in the laying pens.Laying begins in April and the eggs are picked up twice a day and washed and trayed ready for the incu_ bator.After 3 weeks in the incubator the eggs are transferred to a hatcher. After hatching the chicks are placed in specially heated pens and looked after very carefully.At 6 weeks old the poults move to small pens in the wood and a week later are released in_ to the wild.The keeper still feeds them and looks after them until the shooting season starts in October.Then the whole thing starts all over again. It is a busy life,but interesting.
